content:
IRemindable IRemindable Interface

Definition

Namespace:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.Runtime
Assembly:
Microsoft.ServiceFabric.Actors.dll

Interface which actors that use reminders must implement.

Edit

In this Article

public interface IRemindablePublic Interface IRemindable

Methods

ReceiveReminderAsync(String, Byte[], TimeSpan, TimeSpan) ReceiveReminderAsync(String, Byte(), TimeSpan, TimeSpan)

Edit

Reminder call back invoked when an actor reminder is triggered.

Task ReceiveReminderAsync(string reminderName, byte[] context, TimeSpan dueTime, TimeSpan period)Function ReceiveReminderAsync(reminderName As String, context As Byte(), dueTime As TimeSpan, period As TimeSpan) As Task
Parameters
reminderName
String String

Name of reminder.

context
Byte[] Byte()

Context associated with this reminder was passed to Actors runtime when reminder was created.

dueTime
TimeSpan TimeSpan

Time when reminder with name reminderName is due.

period
TimeSpan TimeSpan

The time interval between triggering of reminder with name reminderName.

Returns
Task Task

A task that represents the asynchronous operation performed by this callback.

Remarks

When a reminder is triggered, Actors runtime will invoke ReceiveReminderAsync method on the Actor. An actor can register multiple reminders and the ReceiveReminderAsync method is invoked any time any of those reminders is triggered. The actor can use the reminder name that is passed in to the ReceiveReminderAsync method to figure out which reminder was triggered.

The Actors runtime saves the actor state when the ReceiveReminderAsync call completes. If an error occurs in saving the state, that actor object will be deactivated and a new instance will be activated. to specify that the state need not be saved upon completion of the reminder

.
